title: Missing Closing Parenthesis in index.js Causing Syntax Error
root_cause_summary: The Node.js application failed to start due to a syntax error in the index.js file. Specifically, there's a missing closing parenthesis in the res.send() function call on line 6.
root_cause_detailed: The JavaScript engine encountered a SyntaxError when trying to parse the index.js file. The error message 'missing ) after argument list' indicates that a function call, specifically res.send(), is not properly closed with a parenthesis. This syntax error prevents the Node.js application from starting, causing the CI/CD pipeline to fail at the 'npm start' step.

fix_suggestions.title: Add Missing Closing Parenthesis in index.js
fix_suggestions.description: This fix directly addresses the syntax error by adding the missing closing parenthesis to the res.send() function call in index.js.
implementation_steps: Step 2: Locate the res.send() function call on line 6
Step 3: Add a closing parenthesis at the end of the line
Step 4: Save the file and commit the changes

fix_suggestions.title: Use a JavaScript Linter
fix_suggestions.description: Implement a JavaScript linter in the development process to catch syntax errors before they reach the CI/CD pipeline.
implementation_steps: Step 1: Install a linter like ESLint
Step 2: Configure ESLint for your project
Step 3: Run the linter on all JavaScript files
Step 4: Fix any issues reported by the linter
Step 5: Add a linting step to your CI/CD pipeline

fix_suggestions.title: Implement Pre-commit Hooks
fix_suggestions.description: Set up pre-commit hooks to automatically check for syntax errors before code is committed to the repository.
implementation_steps: Step 2: Configure pre-commit hooks in package.json
Step 3: Set up lint-staged to run ESLint on JavaScript files
Step 4: Commit the changes and test the pre-commit hook

research_summary: Web research confirmed that the 'SyntaxError: missing ) after argument list' is commonly caused by incomplete function calls in JavaScript. It also highlighted the importance of proper syntax checking and validation in CI/CD processes.
